Metadata: Chemostat fermentation of "Xanthomonas campestris" with a small working volume

Xanthan gum is a polysaccharide produced by the obligate aerobic bacterium "Xanthomonas campestris." Xanthan gum provides stable viscosity over a wide range of temperatures and has compatibility with high ionic environments. This paper describes a strategy for chemostat fermentation of "X. campestris" for evaluating its physiological processes and for xanthan gum production.
